turns.content: how many languages in the world ?List the top 30 in the order of most people using them.

According to Ethnologue, a comprehensive catalog of the world's languages, there are approximately 7,117 languages in the world as of 2021.

Here are the top 30 languages in the order of most people using them:

1. Chinese (Mandarin) - 1.3 billion
2. Spanish - 460 million
3. English - 379 million
4. Hindi - 341 million
5. Arabic - 315 million
6. Bengali - 228 million
7. Portuguese - 221 million
8. Russian - 154 million
9. Japanese - 128 million
10. Punjabi - 102 million
11. German - 99 million
12. Javanese - 84 million
13. Wu (Shanghainese) - 80 million
14. French - 79 million
15. Telugu - 75 million
16. Vietnamese - 74 million
17. Marathi - 73 million
18. Korean - 71 million
19. Tamil - 68 million
20. Turkish - 68 million
21. Urdu - 66 million
22. Italian - 65 million
23. Yue (Cantonese) - 62 million
24. Thai - 61 million
25. Gujarati - 56 million
26. Jin - 50 million
27. Southern Min (Hokkien) - 48 million
28. Persian (Farsi) - 47 million
29. Polish - 45 million
30. Pashto - 40 million

It's worth noting that the number of speakers of each language can vary depending on how the language is defined and measured.
